Detailed Description

An instance of this class represents the result of a prior call to REngine::replayTimeBars().

The TimeBarReplayInfo class is used to convey the conclusion and/or response code associated with a call to REngine::replayTimeBars().

See also:
TimeBarInfo
REngine::subscribeTimeBar()
REngine::unsubscribeTimeBar()
REngine::replayTimeBars()
RCallbacks::TimeBar()
RCallbacks::TimeBarReplay()

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

TimeBarReplayInfo::TimeBarReplayInfo (  ) 

This constructor initializes all of the members. The pData of each tsNCharcb is set to MNM_EMPTY_DATA_ITEM and the iDataLen of each tsNCharcb is set to MNM_EMPTY_DATA_ITEM_LEN. Integer members and double members are initialized to zero. Boolean members are set to false. Pointer values are set to NULL.

TimeBarReplayInfo::~TimeBarReplayInfo (  )  [virtual]

This destructor will not deallocate memory associated with internal pointers such as the pData of any tsNCharcbs.

Member Function Documentation

int TimeBarReplayInfo::dump ( int *  aiCode  ) 

This routine will print the current values of the object to stdout. The precision of the output may not reflect the actual precision of the value. For example, doubles may only be printed to six decimal places, even if the value of the double has a greater significant precision.

Member Data Documentation

TimeBarReplayInfo::iEndSsboe

The end ssboe passed in the initial call.

TimeBarReplayInfo::iRpCode

The response code associated with the response to REngine::replayTrades().

TimeBarReplayInfo::iStartSsboe

The start ssboe passed in the initial call.

TimeBarReplayInfo::pContext

The context passed into REngine::replayTimeBars(), initiating this callback.

TimeBarReplayInfo::sExchange

The exchange passed in the initial call.

TimeBarReplayInfo::sRpCode

The string equivalent of the response code TimeBarReplayInfo::iRpCode. If TimeBarReplayInfo::iRpCode equals API_OK, this string may be empty.

TimeBarReplayInfo::sTicker

The ticker passed in the initial call.
